description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to strengthen the BF Program's ability to achieve its objective of reducing poverty and inequality and promoting human capital development by improving schooling and health status of children and reducing incidence of malnutrition among the poor population. The proposed operation would achieve this objective by supporting: (a) the strengthening of the program's overall governance through enhanced basic program management functions and accountability, oversight and control functions, in three axes: the registry of beneficiaries (Cadastro Unico), management of benefits, and monitoring of conditionalities; (b) the consolidation of the program?s monitoring and evaluation system; and (c) the strengthening of linkages between Bolsa Familia beneficiaries with complementary actions beyond the program to promote graduation from poverty; these activities would be carried out through the National Commitment for Social Development strategy in the MDS.

title.narrative: Beneficiaries of Safety Nets programs - Other cash transfers programs (number)
Beneficiaries of social safety net programs
Number of State Governments using Cadastro Único for the selection of beneficiaries for their state social programs.
Monitoring and Evaluation System of MDS consolidated
In-house DPI procurement and FM capacity strengthened (staff hired and trained)
Percentage of updated records in Cadastro Único version 7.0 by December 2017
Percentage of households in the first quintile receiving transfers from Bolsa Familia Program
Percentage of children aged 0-6 and pregnant women in beneficiary families complying with heath conditionalities
Percentage of youth (16-17 years old) whose school attendance is being monitored by the program.
Percentage of beneficiary children of primary school age (6-15 years old) whose school attendance is being monitored by the program.
Number of agreements signed with the States in the context of the BSM program
Percentage of direct beneficiares of the Bolsa Familia cash transfer who are women
Baseline data for Criança Feliz program has been collected
Number of Bolsa Familia children of age 0-3 that received house visits as part of the early childhood development program Criança Feliz
Rate of updated registries in the last two years in Cadastro Único
